verses.name: Proverbs 14:1
verses.text: Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:2
verses.text: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the Lord: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:3
verses.text: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:4
verses.text: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:5
verses.text: A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:6
verses.text: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy unto him that understandeth.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:7
verses.text: Go from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not in him the lips of knowledge.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:8
verses.text: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:9
verses.text: Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous there is favour.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:10
verses.text: The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:11
verses.text: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:12
verses.text: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:13
verses.text: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:14
verses.text: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:15
verses.text: The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:16
verses.text: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:17
verses.text: He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:18
verses.text: The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:19
verses.text: The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:20
verses.text: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich hath many friends.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:21
verses.text: He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy is he.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:22
verses.text: Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:23
verses.text: In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:24
verses.text: The crown of the wise is their riches: but the foolishness of fools is folly.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:25
verses.text: A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful witness speaketh lies.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:26
verses.text: In the fear of the Lord is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:27
verses.text: The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:28
verses.text: In the multitude of people is the king’s honour: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:29
verses.text: He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:30
verses.text: A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:31
verses.text: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:32
verses.text: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:33
verses.text: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but that which is in the midst of fools is made known.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:34
verses.text: Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:35
verses.text: The king’s favour is toward a wise servant: but his wrath is against him that causeth shame.
